What does the OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag do when defining a PBaaS chain or gateway?
The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag (value 64) restricts a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency. This means that the chain or gateway can only work with one specific currency.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY flag when defining a PBaaS chain or gateway?

The OPTION_GATEWAY flag (value 128) indicates that a PBaaS chain or gateway routes external currencies. This means that the chain or gateway is capable of handling currencies from outside the Verus ecosystem.

a token, not a native currency

OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What does the OPTION_PBAAS flag do when defining a PBaaS chain?
The OPTION_PBAAS flag (value 256) indicates that a chain definition is for a PBaaS chain. This flag is used to specify that a chain is a Private Blockchain as a Service (PBaaS) chain.

a token, not a native currency

OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID

```
What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag when defining a PBaaS gateway?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag (value 512) indicates that a PBaaS gateway is a default converter and will publish prices. This means that the gateway will provide conversion rates and prices for currencies.
```

What does the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag do when defining a PBaaS gateway?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag (value 1024) determines where top-level ID and currency registration happen. If this flag is not set on a gateway, registration happens on the launch chain. If it is set, registration happens elsewhere.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What is the purpose of the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag when defining a token?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag (value 2048) indicates that a token is a single satoshi NFT (Non-Fungible Token) token, which tokenizes control over the root ID. This means that the token has a unique identity and can be used to control access to a specific ID or resource.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency

OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
